summary: Linear progress bar for indicating completion percentage or upload progress.
recommendations: Use the `variant` prop to switch between `determinate` (known percentage) and `indeterminate` (unknown duration) modes — default is `determinate`.
Pass `progressValue` as a number between 0–100 for determinate progress; it has no effect in `indeterminate` mode.
Use `color` and `bgColor` to accept CSS variables (e.g. `--i500`) or raw hex values — both are parsed via `parseCssVariable`.
Set `isBlurred` to true to visually obscure sensitive progress (e.g. hidden data); this forces height to 5px and renders a blurred neutral bar regardless of `progressValue`.
Control dimensions with `height` (default `12px`) and `width` (default `100%`) — these map to MUI `LinearProgress` sx styles.
Wrap with `ComponentContainer` for consistent layout context; avoid providing conflicting outer width constraints.
